page.title: 02CUSTOMS OF CASTLETON
page.content: It takes place annually on 29th May, the day on which Charles II rode through the streets of London. the Garland is a huge bee_hive frame covered with flowers represent the Oak tree in which King Charles hid from the Roundheads. The King and his Consort ride round the village on horses. The village silver Band follow the horses,playing the Garland tune. The young village girls follow them and wear white dresses with wild flower stitched on. The girls carry miniature maypole sticks. The procession stops at each inn for the Garland Dance itself. The Garland is hauled up the Church Tower. Then the girls dance round the maypole in the Market Place.The Garland is an ancient ceremony
